title: IPAD: Inverse Prompt for AI Detection - A Robust and Explainable LLM-Generated Text Detector
author: Zheng Chen (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Yushi Feng (The University of Hong Kong), Changyang He (Max Planck Institute), Yue Deng (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Hongxi Pu (University of Michigan), Bo Li (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), ...
relevance_why: This work proposes a novel text detection framework that could be applied to audio-language models needing verification against LLM-generated texts.
background: Detecting whether a piece of text is generated by a human or a Large Language Model (LLM) is crucial due to the potential misuse of AI in various domains.
contribution: This paper introduces IPAD, a framework that integrates a Prompt Inverter and a Distinguisher to improve the detection of LLM-generated texts, achieving enhanced robustness and explainability.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing AI detection methods often lack robustness in real-world scenarios and do not provide clear evidence for their classifications.
technical_comparison.novelty: IPAD overcomes these limitations by using a two-part approach that predicts generation prompts and evaluates alignment with input texts.

key_innovation: The unique integration of a Prompt Inverter and two types of Distinguishers offers a transparent, step-by-step reasoning process that enhances both accuracy and explainability in text detection.
real_world_impact: The proposed framework can significantly aid organizations in validating the authenticity of written materials, helping mitigate academic dishonesty and misinformation.
limitations: The Prompt Inverter may struggle with complex prompts that use explicit examples, prioritizing semantic alignment over syntactic accuracy.

new_terms.Prompt Inverter: **Prompt Inverter** is a component that identifies likely prompts that could have generated specific input texts, enhancing the accuracy of text detection.
new_terms.Distinguisher: **Distinguisher** refers to the classifier that uses predicted prompts or regenerated texts to ascertain whether the input text is human-written or generated by an LLM.
